did.unittitle: Lozano Dry Goods Co., 3101 M Street NW, Fire Court Case

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection appears to have been donated by Mrs. Howard (Hannah) Cayton, 3069 Canal Street, NW, during the tenure of Peabody Room "curator" Mathilde Williams (1950-1978).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: On December 24, 1897 a fire destroyed the Lozano Dry Goods Company, located at 3101 M Street, NW and 1208, 1210, 1212, and 1214 31st Street, NW. A subsequent lawsuit was filed by the company against six fire insurance companies* to recover various dollar amounts of insurance granted by the companies for the loss of stock and fixtures. *Albany Fire Insurance Company of New York, $2,000 Citizens' Insurance Company of Pennsylvania, $2,000 German Alliance Insurance Company and the German American Insurance Company of New York, $2,500 Hartford Fire Insurance Company of Connecticut, $2,500 Manchester Fire Assurance Company of England, $2,500 Western Insurance Company of Pennsylvania, $2,500 No documentation is included in this collection that reveals the result of the lawsuit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: - Lozano Dry Goods Co.; listing of inventory stock and fixtures lost in December 24, 1897 fire. -Supreme Court of the District of Columbia, The Lozano Dry Goods Company vs. The Albany Insurance Company, September 3, 1897 - Wolf and Rosenberg, Attorneys and Counsellors at Law, 507 E Street, NW, Washington, DC; case records folder containing correspondence from January 1898. - Wolf and Rosenberg, Attorneys and Counsellors at Law, 507 E Street, NW, Washington, DC; case records folder containing correspondence from January 3, 1898 to May 9, 1898.
